trans-unit.target: TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_SEQ_00<tab>One does not simply cross the Ruby Sea, as Soroban well knows.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_TODO_00<tab>Follow Lyse.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Soroban.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Tansui.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_LYSE_000_000<tab>Somewhere out there, across the water, is Yugiri and Gosetsu's homeland...
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_ALISAIE_000_005<tab>Woe betide any enemy foolish enough to attack by sea. Now, if the Garleans were to bring their <var 1A 02 /var>airships<var 1A 01 /var>, on the other hand...
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_GOSETSU_000_010<tab>The Hingans built this island as a bulwark against invasion, and filled it with enough cannons to sink an armada.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_SOROBAN_000_020<tab>Now, in order to reach the shores of Othard, you will need to cross the resplendent waters you see before you. However, this is easier said than done.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_SOROBAN_000_021<tab>To set forth without making the necessary preparations is to invite the Confederacy to claim your vessel─and your life should you resist.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_SOROBAN_000_022<tab>But this fate can be avoided by paying the Ruby Tithe, thereby earning you the blessing of the pirate lords.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_SOROBAN_000_023<tab>So─let us go and greet them. Our destination is the isle to the west.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_LYSE_000_024<tab>That doesn't look very far to me. <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, why don't we jump in and swim for it? I've had my fill of boats.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_SOROBAN_000_025<tab>Hmm, an excellent idea! I think you shall find the water to your liking.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_SOROBAN_000_026<tab>I will use my ship to deliver those less inclined to the isle.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_ALISAIE_000_030<tab>Not that I've anything against the occasional dip in the ocean, but to dive in on a whim is a bit...hm.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_GOSETSU_000_035<tab>Ho, what spirit you two have to delight in this simple joy so readily!
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_SOROBAN_000_040<tab>Hm? Is Lyse not with you?
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_LYSE_000_050<tab>Right, this should be easy! And a good way to loosen up before the next fight, whenever it comes.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_LYSE_000_051<tab>Twenty gil says I beat you there!
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_LYSE_000_060<tab><pant> <pant> ...Not bad. We'll call it a draw!
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_SOROBAN_000_070<tab>Ah, there you are. I trust you enjoyed yourselves.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_SOROBAN_000_071<tab>Follow me, my friends. The one with whom we must speak is a man named Tansui.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_LYSE_000_080<tab>Ugh... My clothes have mostly dried, but they're a bit clingy. Still, no regrets!

TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_ALISAIE_000_085<tab>I wonder─Lominsan pirates have been known to say things like, “Arrr,” but surely pirates on the opposite side of the world would use different expressions? “Errr,” or “Urrr,” or “Arururu,” perhaps?

TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_GOSETSU_000_090<tab>Doma's position on the Confederacy could be best described as one of “guarded acceptance.” They are pirates, aye, but they adhere to a code and are a stabilizing force in the Ruby Sea.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_SOROBAN_000_095<tab>This one is Tansui. Come, come, introduce yourselves.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_TANSUI_000_100<tab>...I fear you have the advantage of me.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_TANSUI_000_101<tab>Most honorable and esteemed <var 29 EB02 /var>. I am Tansui, a humble mate who serves at the pleasure of the Confederacy's captain.
TEXT_STMBDA301_02477_TANSUI_000_102<tab>As you are in the company of the shellback, I presume we have business to discuss...
